definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I don't know if he's really leaving his job; it may only be hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是否真的已經去職，那也許只是傳聞。

sentences.english: I left the office on acount of the discontinuance of the business.
sentences.chinese: 由於所服務的公司解散，只好去職。

sentences.english: I left the position with the desire of improving my position.
sentences.chinese: 我爲了找更高之職位，而請求去職。

sentences.english: my reason for leaving the company is that i wish to get into the advertising business.
sentences.chinese: 本人去職的緣故原由是希望在廣告業方面有所成長。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
